name: Disco
description: Combines the lush orchestration of Philly Soul and bass grooves of Funk with a four-on-the-floor rhythm.

children.name: Boogie
children.description: Continuation of the Disco sound with increased influence from Funk, Synth Funk, and R&B and a slower tempo, often featuring drum machines and filter modulated synthesizers.

children.name: Electro-Disco
children.description: Disco instrumentation is largely - if not entirely - replaced by synthesizers and augmented with futuristic elements such as the vocoder.

children.name: Euro-Disco
children.description: European style that moved away from the genre's Rhythm & Blues and Soul roots, speeding up the tempo and adding Electronic instruments like synthesizers and drum machines as a backing for more melodic Europop-influenced vocals.

children.name: Latin Disco
children.description: Disco that incorporates elements from Hispanic American Music styles.

children.name: Mutant Disco
children.description: Danceable basslines, syncopated grooves, and angular guitar riffs, characterized by a spirit of experimentation and integration of disparate sounds.

children.name: Nu-Disco
children.description: 21st-century trend mixing modern, polished Electronic production with the aesthetics, structures, and lively, organic beats of 1970s and 1980s Disco.
